fields.description:
There's a problem with creating a link in wiki markup that contains a trailing space.  When you create a link to a space that doesn't exist, clicking the link creates the page.  When there's a trailing space, the page is created without the space.  If you rename the page, the original link is not updated.

Steps to reproduce:

# Using the wiki markup editor, create a link to a nonexistant page, as in \[Helloworld|helloworld123 \] (note the trailing space)
# Click the link to create a new page and save the page.
# Rename the child page
# Open the original page and note that the incoming link is not updated with the new page location (as it would be if there were no trailing space)

The problem was reported by a customer running 3.0 but can be reproduced in Confluence 3.2.1.
fields.summary: Problems when creating link in wiki markup with a trailing space

fields.summary: license/version  information does not stay at bottum of page

fields.description:
When exporting page/space to PDF, the URL generated to download the file (and the file itself) contains a readable form of the current date and time.

If you export a single page to PDF via {{Tools -> Export to PDF}}, the name of temp directory where the export is generated and the name of the file are wrongly encoded in the download URL for languages where the name of the month contains non ISO Latin 1 characters.

The URL contains a time stamp token formatted as upon the default locale of the JVM.

E.g. in Hungarian:

Page export leads to download URL:
{{http://localhost:8080/download/temp/pdfexport-20100608-08j%FAn.10-1014DE-7/PDF-Home-08j%FAn.10-1014DE-8.pdf?contentType=application/pdf}}

Trying to download the PDF via this URL, I get 403 errors. Although the file is correctly generated in the file system.

While space export leads to download URL:
{{http://localhost:8080/download/temp/pdfexport-20100608-08j%C3%BAn.10-1017DE-11/PDF-08j%C3%BAn.10-1017DE-12.pdf}}

This URL works fine, PDF can be downloaded.

The problem comes from the wrong encoding of the timestamp token: "08j%FAn.10-1014DE", which should be "08jún.10-1004DE".

*Note:* The name of the month in Hungarian is "jún". The letter "ú" is encoded as "%FA" (ISO Latin 1 encoding) in the first case (Export page to PDF), while as "%C3%BA" (UTF8 encoding) in the other case (Export space to PDF). 

Please make sure the URLs are properly encoded like in Export space to PDF.

BTW: the same is true for Export page to Word.

This is a new bug as up to Confluence 3.1 exports contained the space key and numbers.
fields.summary: Export page to PDF leads to 403 - wrong encoding of file names

Word doc is attached.

fields.description:
To replicate:

# Create a page 'Page One' (target).
# Create another page 'Page Two' (linking). Create a link to 'Page One' wrapped in \{warning} macro.
# Rename 'Page One' to 'Page One Test'.
# Refresh 'Page Two'. The link will still refer to 'Page One' not 'Page One Test'. As a result, it will be displayed in red and clicking on it will create a new page called 'Page One' (normal Confluence behaviour).

Removing the \{warning} macro causes the links to function correctly.
fields.summary: Text box macros (warning, info, etc) breaks dynamic updating of links to other pages

fields.description:
The "view" button present for page gadget in IE and Firefox is not available in Safari.  Screenshot is attached.

The view button appears if the page selected for page gadget was created by someone else, but not if the page was created by me.
fields.summary: Page gadget does not have a "view" button in Safari

fields.description:
I think this happened because of the way I accessed the page through the page gadget.  

When viewing the page in a jira page gadget, I clicked "view" which opened the page in Confluence then clicked on the padlock. 


If I add a page in Confluence with restrictions and save it, clicking on the padlock does what it is supposed to do.
fields.summary: Clicking the permissions padlock when viewing a page shows a corrupted permissions dialog box.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

    * IE6
    * Space theme was 'Documentation'
      1. Edit page > Rich Text or Markup (it doesn't matter)
      2. Click on the 'Link Browser'
      3. Nothing happens > An error appears in the bottom-left of the IE window
      4. Clicking the 'Macro Browser' or the 'Image Browser' does work, & sometimes the 'Link Browser' will work after that.

IE produced this error:
Webpage error details

Line: 74

Char: 13

Error: Object doesn't support this property or method

Code: 0

URL: https://localhost/pages/editpage.action?Co
fields.summary: Problem with Link Browser button in IE6

fields.description:
On the page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Standalone+Distribution

Under "Before you start", step 8, the link to the "Confluence Extension space" is an old link (to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Home) as this has been migrated by Atlassian, and should link to the Confluence area on the Plugins Exchange (https://plugins.atlassian.com/search/by/confluence)

Not sure where this ticket should actually go, since its a documentation issue, not a confluence product issue.
fields.summary: Link error in Confluence 3.2.1 upgrade guide on confluence.atlassian.com

fields.description: Creating a child page in Confluence from a Global template when using Internet Explorer version 8.0.6 does not work correctly. It  creates an empty page when you click insert variables.
fields.summary: Page errors when creating a new page from template in Internet Explorer IE 8.0.6

fields.description:
According to this [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Inserting+Images+in+the+Rich+Text+Editor#InsertingImagesintheRichTextEditor-AddinganImageviaDragandDrop]:
bq. Simply drag the image from your computer and drop it into the Rich Text Editor window. *The image will be displayed in the position where you dropped it.*

In Internet Explorer (tested on IE version 7 and 8) the image is inconsistently positioned:
* Sometimes it is positioned in the last position of the cursor
* Sometimes it is positioned in the position where you drop it
* Most of the times it is positioned in the beginning of the page.

In Firefox, it works fine as expected.

For example, I tried to put an image after the second word of the second paragraph. Here is the result screen-shots:
* [Correct result in Firefox|^img_DragDrop_FF.png]
* [Incorrect result in Internet Explorer|^img_DragDrop_IE.png]
fields.summary: Inconsistently positioned image when adding an Image via Drag and Drop in Rich Text Editor in IE

fields.description:
I added a page gadget to a Jira dashboard and used the "Space" text box to search for my personal space from qa-eac (mcompton)

The following searches revealed nothing:
mcompton
~mcompton
Marlena Compton
home
Home
fields.summary: Page Gadget space text box does not find my personal space or even any space named "Home" or "home"

fields.description:
The width for page gadget is controlled by a number which makes it difficult to create a page width gadget.  Since the gadget is specifically for viewing pages, being able to see a page with page width is important, especially if the page is lenghthy. 

Currently, if a user wants to scroll right to left on a lengthy page, they must scroll all the way to the bottom first, which means they lose their place on the page.
fields.summary: No way to easily tell the Page Gadget to be page width

fields.description:
Currently, typing the name of a page or space kicks off the authentication process for a Confluence page gadget.  

This is frustrating because it means the user has wasted keystrokes on a dialog that should be presented before the user has the ability to search for anything at all.  

Also, the button for "login approval" has an unpolished look unlike the other buttons in the gadget dialog.
fields.summary: Authenticating Confluence through the page gadget is awkward and ugly

fields.description:
The error message shown when page gadget tries to access a restricted page isn't very informative and contains a url that has no meaning in the context of the actual problem.  Perhaps could say something like "This content is restricted."

There's something wrong with the state as well.  After I hit cancel, the dark gray sticks around.
fields.summary: Page Gadget error message for inaccessible content needs to be tidied up

fields.description:
Steps to re-produce:

# Go to a page
# Add a comment 
# Press submit (dont enter any text in the comment) 

You get this error:
{code}Comment text is empty. Cannot create empty comments. {code}

But lose all the body of the page. It shouldn't lose the page body text
fields.summary: Adding an empty comment on a page fails

fields.description:
Drag drop does not work in Confluence 3.3-BETA2

More specifically, drag and drop was broken on the: 

- view content screen
- view attachments screen (+drop zone)

Attempting to perform a drag and drop on these screens in firefox 3.5/3.6 resulted in the image being displayed in the browser (but the image does not get attached).

It should be noted that Drag and drop continues to work inside the editor and the image browser.
fields.summary: Drag drop does not work in BETA-2

Fixes:
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/PGTR-79

fields.description:
The following snippet will cause Confluence *not* to find the velocity templates:

{code}    <xwork key="space-admin-actions" name="Scroll Space Template Actions">
        <package name="Scroll Admin Actions" extends="spaces" namespace="/spaces/com.k15t.scroll.office">
            <default-interceptor-ref name="defaultStack"/>
            <action name="templates" class="com.k15t.scroll.office.web.admin.SpacesTemplatesAction" method="action">
                <result name="success" type="velocity">/com/k15t/scroll/office/templates/admin/templates-spaces.vm
                </result>
                <result name="error" type="velocity">/com/k15t/scroll/office/templates/admin/templates-spaces.vm
                </result>
                <result name="none" type="redirect">/spaces/com.k15t.scroll.office/templates.action?key=${space.Key}
                </result>
            </action>
        </package>
    </xwork>{code}

It would be nice if you could trim the whitespace, as idea will introduce the white-spaces on code-formatting.
fields.summary: atlassian-plugin.xml: trim white spaces

Select confluence page gadget from the macro browser

type in the "page" box.  As soon as you start typing in the box, the message,"you must select a page" appears.  After typing in the name of the page and moving focus away from the "page" box. The message is still there.

fields.description:
An incorrect error message is displayed in the following scenario:

# Open a page with attachments
# Click {{Tools->Attachments}} and arrive on the attachment page.
# Click {{Properties}} next to an attachment of interest and arrive on a page providing the attachment's properties.
# Click {{Tools->Link to this Page...}}

The error message ""Due to customizations made to this space's layout...." is displayed. Click on "OK" to close the dialog, to land on the {{viewinfo.action}} URL of the page.
 
This appears to be have been a side-affect of [CONF-17573|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-17573].
fields.summary: Incorrect error message prompted for "Link to this Page..."

fields.description:
When attempting to edit a word document that is attached to a confluence page, we continually get the error message that the file name is to long. We have had to shorten the file name and page names to be so short that the page title does not make sense anymore. It has made the use of this feature unuasble.

Here is an example of a document title 'Prospect Count By Staff and Rating' that we tried to use and we recieve the error. The word document had this title as well. We shortened the document name to be a.docx, and we still got the error message. We had to the page title to be 'Prpt Count Staff Rating' to get it to save the file. The page name makes no sense and searching for thw word document makes no sense now.

We now need to save the file on a shared server, edit it there, and then drag back into confluence to update. It is making the process unuseable.
fields.summary: Unable to edit in word with document titles that are considered to long
Rank search results by frequency of access or pages I've recently viewed

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce

# First attach an image to a new Confluence page
# Next, create the following markup in the page:
{code}
!spaceKey:PageTitle^ImageName.gif|width="606"!
{code}
[Screenshot|^WikiMarkup.png]
# The image will be displayed as usual
# However, when you edit the page again and do some roundtrips (Wiki-markup -> Rich Text editor), the Wiki Markup becomes:
{code}
!spaceKey:PageTitle^ImageName.gif|width=606"606"!
{code}
[Screenshot|^AfterRoundTrip.png]
# More round-trips causes more duplicate values for the width parameter:
{code}
!spaceKey:PageTitle^ImageName.gif|width=606"606""606""606"!
{code}
# At this point, you are still allowed to edit and save the page. 
# However, when there's a page title change, you are not allowed to save the page anymore. You will get an Oops page with the following error:
{code}
org.w3c.dom.DOMException: INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: An invalid or illegal XML character is specified.
    at org.apache.xerces.dom.CoreDocumentImpl.createAttribute(Unknown Source) 
{code}
#* Screenshots:
[^RenamingPage.png]
[^AfterRenamingRichText.png]
[^AfterSaving.png]
# You are also not allowed to switch to Wiki Markup editor to fix the markup.
[^CantAccessWikiMarkup.png]

h5. Workaround
# Don't use the quotes for the value. For example:
{code}
!spaceKey:PageTitle^ImageName.gif|width=606!
{code}
fields.summary: Round-trips after entering image markup with width parameter (with quoted value)  along with a page rename causes INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR error

fields.description: It would be better if there is a note in [Form Field Markup for Templates|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/hyAC] which warns the customer that Form Field Markup should only be used in Templates. Using it in normal page can cause a problem as described in [CONF-19915]

fields.summary: Removing a page permission triggers a page delete operation

fields.description:
Open links browser
hit esc to close browser

you will get a javascript error:
Message: 'this.element' is null or not an object
Line: 339
Char: 2617
Code: 0
URI: https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/s/1906/59/8/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js

From Mark Hrynczak's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/RTE+Blitz+test+3.3-beta1+-+Mark's+IE8+results
fields.summary: Closing links dialog with escape key causes IE Javascript error

fields.description:
insert a link
open links browser
use search to select a different link

The link text should not change but will now show the text of the newly selected link.  

From Mark Hrynczak's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/RTE+Blitz+test+3.3-beta1+-+Mark's+IE8+results
fields.summary: Links browser link text should not change when link is changed

fields.description:
After typing in ':' (a colon character) the auto-complete context disappears. After erasing the colon with backspace there is no way to get auto-complete back other than erasing the whole text and starting again with the initial '{' character

From Dariusz Kordonski's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Results+-+Dariusz+Kordonski
fields.summary: backspacing over a colon does not bring back the macro-autocomplete dialog

fields.description:
If I leave a space, then start another macro (after a blog-posts macro), the auto-complete comes up, but once I go into the editor, I'm actually editing the blog-posts macro rather than creating a new macro of the type I selected

From Matthew Watson's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Matthew+Watson's+Errors

h3. Workaround 

Go to next line before trying to open macro browser.
fields.summary: opening macro browser immediately after another macro opens the browser in edit mode for the previous macro
Macro autocomplete does not work immediately after the closing bracket of another macro

fields.description:
open macro browser and search for and select "blog posts macro."

The error "Unable to render macro: Required parameter "0" not provided"

is visible in the macro browser.  

From Matthew Watson's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Matthew+Watson's+Errors
fields.summary: Blog posts report macro is not functioning

fields.description:
create a code block using the \{code} macro.
Place the cursor within the code block
Hit the macro button in the editor

The macro browser will be opened, but there is not to edit the code macro.

From Matthew Watson's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Matthew+Watson's+Errors
fields.summary: opening macro browser with focus set in a macro does not give edit options for that macro

fields.description:
From Hamish Barney's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Hamish+Results
fields.summary: Image markers appear outside editor frame

fields.description:
Add a page
Add a pair of empty braces {}

Add a pair of empty braces with a space between them.  

You will get a javascript error.  Screenshot is attached.

From Hamish Barney's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Hamish+Results
fields.summary: Adding multiple sets of braces to a page results in a js error on IE8

fields.description:
Suggestions list is not very useful when it goes off-screen. It would be better in these cases to show the suggestion list above the element instead of below it.

From Hamish Barney's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Hamish+Results
fields.summary: Suggestion list goes offscreen

fields.description:
Adding text immediately after image configured with property panel results in the 

image not being displayed (text is rendered instead). To reproduce:
1. add image
2. change size/border with property panel
3. enter text immediately after image (no space)
4. save page
5. text rendered instead of image (this does not occur if you repeat without step 2)

From Andrew Prentice's blitz test results
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/APs+Safari+4+3.3-beta-1+editor+findings
fields.summary: Adding text immediately after an image and saving results in the text being concatenated onto image link

fields.description:
add a large image to a page using the image autocomplete
add text immediately after the image
the cursor will be as large as the image.

screenshot attached.
fields.summary: adding text right after a large image makes for an extremely large cursor
Unable to edit image from property panel (unlike link property panel)

fields.description:
Copy an image
add a page
paste the image onto the page
you will be able to see the image
click on preview
There will be an error for the image
go back to RTE there will be a blue box

From Andrew Prentice's blitz test results:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/APs+Safari+4+3.3-beta-1+editor+findings
fields.summary: Images pasted into the RTE show up in the RTE but not in preview

fields.description:
* Use Safari
* Enter text: http://example.com
* Click the link to bring up the property panel
* Click 'Unlink'

The link is removed. The expected behaviour is that it inserts the 'nolink' macro around the text.
fields.summary: Editor Properties Panel: Unlink removes the text completely when unlinking manually inserted external links in Safari

fields.description:
open link browser
type in http://google.com
do not enter text in link text box
click "insert link"

you will see no text
use arrow key to go back
link property panel will open
fields.summary: Using links browser to insert link with no link text creates link on a page even though there is no text

fields.description:
Using IE7 or IE8, enter the following text in the RTE:

{noformat}http://example.com{noformat}


Press enter, and the text is automatically changed into a link.

Click on it to get the property panel, and select 'Unlink'

As in CONF-19612, the link will still be regenerated when the page is saved.

Instead, it should be applying the 'nolink' macro.


This also applies to the 'unlink' item in the context menu.
fields.summary: Editor Properties Panel: Unlink doesn't work for external links entered in IE
